Work Experience.Company: University of Groningen, Netherlands and Indian Institute of Technology Roorkee, India
Work Experience.Description: Working on elucidating the mechanisms behind Depression, be it behavioural, cognitive or electrophysiological under the supervision of Dr. Partha Pratim Roy, Dr. M.K. Van Vugt and Dr. Niels Taatgen. The research areas includes Computational Cognitive Neuroscience, Deep Learning and Computational Modelling.

Collected EEG data of 27 participants doing guided focused attention meditation. Building a classifier to discriminate different attention conditions using Function Connectivity and Graph Neural Networks.
Collected EEG data of 27 Depressed patients from KGM hospital, Karnal. Identified changes in brain connectivity patterns of Depressed Patients pre-and-post meditation.
Proposed cognitive models like PyIBL as an alternative approach to reinforcement learning. Did a comparison of PyIBL and Q-Learning on Frozen Lake environment from OpenAI gym.
Visited Osaka Prefecture University, Japan under the financial support of JST Sakura Science Plan to have technical discussions in the areas of brain computer interface and deep learning.
Took Labs in the Machine Learning and AI workshops organized by EICT at IIT Roorkee.
TA for Machine Learning (B.Tech. 3rd year) in the spring semester at IIT Roorkee.

Extracurricular Activities.Activity: Reviewer for Nature Scientific Reports, Springer Nature Computer Science, IET Biometrics
Content Editor for ConvNets and Recurrent Neural Networks at Neuromatch 2021
Education Mentor and Alpha Tester for DeepLearning.ai at Coursera 2020
Taught English to village kids at Evidyaloka 2019

personal_info.Name: ANMOL GUPTA
personal_info.Summary: Pursuing double Ph.D. at University of Groningen, Netherlands and Indian Institute of Technology Roorkee, India. Working on elucidating the mechanisms behind Depression, be it behavioural, cognitive or electrophysiological under the supervision of Dr. Partha Pratim Roy, Dr. M.K. Van Vugt and Dr. Niels Taatgen. The research areas includes Computational Cognitive Neuroscience, Deep Learning and Computational Modelling.

Publications.Title: Subject-Specific Cognitive Workload Classification Using EEG-Based Functional Connectivity and Deep Learning
Evaluation of Instance-based Learning and Q-learning algorithms in dynamic environments
Eeg-based age and gender prediction using deep blstm-lstm network model

matches.education: The candidate has a strong educational background in technology and has pursued a double Ph.D. which shows a high level of commitment and expertise.
matches.skills: The candidate has demonstrated skills in Python and deep learning frameworks like Tensorflow and PyTorch, which are required for the job. The candidate also has experience with machine learning, as demonstrated by the projects and research work.
matches.experience: The candidate has a wide range of experience in research and has worked on projects that involve deep learning and computational modeling. The candidate also has teaching experience in deep learning and machine learning.

mismatches.experience: The candidate does not seem to have specific experience as a Machine Learning Engineer, which is a requirement for the job. The candidate's experience is more in research and academia, not specifically in designing and implementing machine learning systems in a business or product context.
mismatches.skills: The job description requires the ability to write robust code in Java and R, but the candidate has not mentioned these skills in the resume.

improvements.experience: The candidate should highlight any experience in designing and implementing machine learning systems, even if it was part of a research project or an internship. If the candidate has experience in a business or product context, it should be clearly stated.
improvements.skills: The candidate should mention any experience with Java and R, even if it's not as strong as their Python skills. If the candidate does not have these skills, they should consider learning them to increase their job prospects.
improvements.presentation: The resume could be improved by making it more concise and focused. It currently includes a lot of information, some of which might not be relevant to the job. The candidate should focus on the most relevant skills, experiences, and accomplishments.
